name: 1.1 Asphalt - submission of asphalt mix design
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Ensure the mix design/s have been registered and are approved by Superintendent prior to laying mix.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: VicRoads Spec. Cl.407.09. RAP DoT letter from production plant
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design from the RAP DoT Letter.
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval via hold point release
RESPONSIBILITY: Site Engineer / Asphalt Supervisor / Superintendent
1.2 Concrete - submission & approval of concrete mix design prior to commencement of project
FREQUENCY: Prior to first concrete pour
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Concrete mix design submitted and approved at least 2 weeks prior to first pour.
• Mix shall contain minimum 460 kg/m3 cement content.
• Special 50 mPa mix is to be VS502B25MET1 with a suitably flowable design slump agreed prior to construction.
REFERENCE DOCUMENTS: CE-019-ST-0033 VicRoads Spec. Cl. 503.04
INSPECTION/TEST METHOD: Correspondence of receipt of mix design from supplier
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval via hold point release
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA: Weld methodology to be submitted prior to commencement of works.
• Welders shall be trained and compliant in Australian aluminothermic welding competencies as outlined below;
– TLIW3015 Weld Rails using Aluminothermic welding process
– TLIW3035 Heat & cut materials using oxy-LPG equipment for the rail industry
RECORD OF CONFORMITY: Superintendent approval via hold point release
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
